paper.title: Action Calculi, or Syntactic Action Structures
paper.abstract: Action structures have previously been proposed as an algebra for both the syntax and the semantics of interactive computation. Here a class of concrete action structures called action calculi is identified, which can serve as a non-linear syntax for a wide variety of models of interactive behaviour. They generalise a previously defined action structure PIC for the Ï€-calculus. One action calculus differs from another only in its generators, called controls.
